info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:58AM EST until January 13 at 2:55AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...North Carolina... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Halifax and Charlotte Counties. Dan River at Dan River at Paces affecting Halifax County. Dan River at South Boston affecting Halifax County. Dan River near Danville affecting Pittsylvania, City of Danville, Caswell and Rockingham independent cities. .Very heavy rain fell across the region Tuesday into early Wednesday. Excessive runoff into the lower portion of the Dan and the Roanoke River basins continues and will for another day or two in most cases. For the Roanoke River...including Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Dan River...including South Boston, Dan River at Paces, STP near Danville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue through much of the weekend, likely not falling below flood stage until Saturday. * WHERE...Dan River at South Boston. * WHEN...Until at least early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Water approaches route 501. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 25.4 feet and rising slowly. Flood stage is 22.0 ft. The river is expected to crest near 26.5 feet late today or tonight. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. Flood stage is 22.0 ft. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EST Thursday was 25.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It is then forecast to fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - For additional information please visit our web site located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Minor flooding is occurring and will continue along the lower portion of the Dan and Roanoke rivers. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For additional information please visit our web site at www.weather.gov/blacksburg. this afternoon at 200 PM EST.
